clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Efficacy and Safety of a Paclitaxel Eluting PTCA Balloon Catheter in Coronary In-stent Restenosis
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Efficacy and Safety of a Paclitaxel Eluting PTCA Balloon Catheter in Coronary In-stent Restenosis: a Randomized, Open-label, Positive Parallel Controlled, Multicenter Clinical Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

collaborator.agency: First Affiliated Hospital of Wenzhou Medical University
Second Affiliated Hospital of Wenzhou Medical University
The Third Xiangya Hospital of Central South University
The Second Hospital of Shandong University
The First Affiliated Hospital of Xiamen University

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: Over the past two decades, stents implantation has developed as a standard treatment for coronary stenosis lesions. However, int-stent restenosis (ISR) was one of the main factors affecting the long-term efficacy of coronary artery interventional therapy, with the incidence of ISR after percutaneous coronary intervention ranging from 5% to 35%. At present, there are three main means for ISR: (1) simple balloon dilation; 2) intravascular radiotherapy; and (3) drug elution stent. But the results are still not ideal. Drug coated balloon (DCB) is a new method that may be used to treat ISR in recent years. In the PEPCAD II study, when dealing with ISR, the paclitaxel eluting balloon (PEB) SeQuent® Please significantly reduced the major adverse cardiovascular events (MACEs) compared to the paclitaxel eluting stent (PES) TAXUS Liberte. In ISR-I and ISR-II trial, it was found that compared with uncoated PTCA balloons, PEB could significantly inhibit endothelial hyperplasia and significantly reduce MACEs treating ISR. The purpose of this study was to assess the efficacy and safety of a Chinese-developed PEB in treatment of coronary ISR compared to SeQuent® Please PEB.

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of target lesion late lumen loss

secondary_outcome.description: Including rate of device success, rate of disease success and rate of clinical success
Cardiac death, target vessel-related myocardial infarction, symptoms-driven target lesion revascularization
All-cause mortality, all myocardial infarction, all revascularization

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of ARC defined thrombosis events
secondary_outcome.description: All definite, probable and possible thrombosis in acute, subacute and late stage

arm_group.description: Treatment of coronary in-stent restenosis with paclitaxel eluting PTCA balloon
Treatment of coronary in-stent restenosis with SeQuent® Please paclitaxel eluting balloon

intervention.description: Treatment of coronary in-stent re-stenosis with paclitaxel eluting PTCA balloon
Treatment of coronary in-stent re-stenosis with SeQuent® Please paclitaxel eluting balloon
